A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Star Wars The Last Jedi is an interesting film. Being that it's the middle child of a sequel trilogy it was important to have developments in the plot and characters that push the series towards the next film. I think it does that. There are certainly plot twists and turns that leave you wondering what will episode 9 bring? But there is so much information to digest in this film that I think it's important to take time to analyze everything and maybe even see the movie again before calling it a bad movie. It's loaded with hints in ideas for episode 9. I disagree with much of the critique for it; I think it is indeed one of the best Star Wars movies made.
